item.title: On the pavement Outside no 136 Victoria Road NW6 6QB, 28th October
item.description:
A woman drove had a car accident some two months ago, knocking down a piece of wall (now repaired) as well as knocking over a street sign. The main body of the street sign was removed but there remains a short metallic stump that is difficult to spot especially in the dark, which anyone can easily trip over. There has been a bag of sand placed over it for weeks but now people might remove the bag when parking their car, then leave the stump exposed. Please can someone remove the metal stump altogether asap, many thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture / DIY/ packaging rubbish, 28th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Park Road, Bermondsey, London

item.title: Tree Growing Towards the Road, 28th October
item.description:
